page.content: Herbert Simpson started this firm with his three sons in the 1920's. Herbert's grandson's Tom and Les now run the business. It was a{bakery}and a{corn merchants}originally but the bakery closed down in the 1950's. They buy corn from the local farms and sell it to millers to produce bread flour, biscuit flour and animal feed. They use their 7 lorries to deliver corn for export to Hull, Liverpool, Boston and Gunness, and bring back fertiliser, poultry food, cow cake, dairy foods. Their annual turnover is almost Â£6 million. The area that they deliver to forms a rough circle linking Newark to Grantham to Melton to Leicester to Nottingham and back to Newark. Their deliveries are made almost entirely in bulk, using 15 ton lorries. {Author:Paul Healing.
